metadata.purpose: Preventive checklist to help avoid common permit refusal reasons

checklist_items.description: Other development permit violations not categorized above

sample_citations.description: NEW: SEMI-DETACHED DWELLING
ADDITION: SINGLE DETACHED DWELLING (MAIN FLOOR - REAR AND EAST ELEVATION)
ADDITION: SINGLE DETACHED DWELLING (COVERED PATIO - REAR)
NEW: SINGLE DETACHED DWELLING
TEMPORARY USE: GENERAL INDUSTRIAL - LIGHT (SEA CANS - 2 (1 YEAR))

prevention_tips: Review all applicable bylaw sections
Consider pre-application meeting
Hire experienced permit consultant
Check DC (Direct Control) district specific rules

checklist_items.description: Sign violations including digital signs, third-party advertising, and sign dimensions
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Sign type not permitted or exceeds size limits

sample_citations.description: TEMPORARY USE: SIGN - CLASS G (DIGITAL THIRD PARTY ADVERTISING SIGN - WITH ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING FACILITY)
TEMPORARY USE: SIGN - CLASS F & G (THIRD PARTY ADVERTISING SIGN - NORTH FACE, DIGITAL THIRD PARTY ADVERTISING SIGN - SOUTH FACE)
TEMPORARY USE: SIGNS (DIGITAL THIRD PARTY ADVERTISING BILLBOARD)
TEMPORARY USE: SIGN - CLASS F (THIRD PARTY ADVERTISING SIGN - 5 YEARS)
TEMPORARY USE: SIGN - CLASS F (THIRD PARTY ADVERTISING SIGN)

prevention_tips: Identify sign classification (A through G)
Verify sign type permitted in your zone
Check maximum sign area and height
Third-party advertising requires special approval

checklist_items.description: Building setback or yard requirement violations
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Structure placed too close to property line
code_references: Land Use Bylaw 1P2007 Part 5 - Residential Districts

sample_citations.description: RELAXATION: SINGLE DETACHED DWELLING (EXISTING) - BUILDING SETBACK FROM REAR PROPERTY LINE, PROJECTIONS INTO REAR SETBACK
RELAXATION: DECK (EXISTING) - PROJECTION INTO SIDE SETBACK
RELAXATION: ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (EXISTING PERGOLA) - SEPARATION FROM MAIN RESIDENTIAL BUILDING, (EXISTING SHEDS) - BUILDING SETBACK FROM SIDE PROPERTY LINE
RELAXATION: ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING - BUILDING SETBACK FROM MAIN BUILDING
ADDITION: SINGLE DETACHED DWELLING (SIDE CARPORT) - PROJECTION INTO SIDE SETBACK

prevention_tips: Verify all setback requirements for your zone before design
Consider applying for a relaxation early in the process
Hire a surveyor to confirm property lines
Review eaves and projection rules separately

checklist_items.description: Land use change not permitted or requires discretionary approval
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Proposed use not listed or requires special approval in zone
code_references: Land Use Bylaw 1P2007 Part 5 - District Regulations

sample_citations.description: CHANGE OF USE: SOCIAL ORGANIZATION
CHANGE OF USE: LIQUOR STORE
REVISION: LIQUOR STORE (CHANGE OF USE TO DP2023-03911)
CHANGE OF USE: INDOOR RECREATION FACILITY, RETAIL AND CONSUMER SERVICE
CHANGE OF USE: PLACE OF WORSHIP - SMALL

prevention_tips: Verify use is permitted in your land use district
Check distance separation for cannabis/liquor stores
Review parking requirements for new use
Consider pre-application consultation

checklist_items.description: Home-based business violations including Class 2 operations
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Business type or scale not permitted as home occupation
code_references: Land Use Bylaw 1P2007 Section 83 - Home Occupation

sample_citations.description: TEMPORARY USE: HOME OCCUPATION - CLASS 2 (CONSTRUCTION CONSULTANT)
TEMPORARY USE: HOME OCCUPATION - CLASS 2 (RETAIL SALES)
TEMPORARY USE: HOME OCCUPATION - CLASS 2 (BARBER)
TEMPORARY USE: HOME OCCUPATION - CLASS 2 (FOOD PREPARATION) - 12 MONTHS
TEMPORARY USE: HOME OCCUPATION - CLASS 2 (FOOD TRUCK) - 1 YEAR

prevention_tips: Review home occupation class requirements
Ensure no external evidence of business
Limit client visits and employee count
Verify business type is permitted

checklist_items.description: Accessory building size, location, or separation violations
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Building too large, too close to main building, or in wrong location
code_references: Land Use Bylaw 1P2007 Section 78 - Accessory Residential Buildings

sample_citations.description: ADDITION: ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (MAIN FLOOR - NORTH SIDE, 2ND FLOOR); CHANGE OF USE: RETAIL AND CONSUMER SERVICE
NEW: TOWNHOUSE (1 BUILDING), ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (GARAGE)
NEW: SEMI-DETACHED DWELLING, ACCESSORY BUILDING (GARAGE)
NEW: SINGLE DETACHED DWELLING (WEST DWELLING), ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (GARAGE)
NEW: SINGLE DETACHED DWELLING (EAST PARCEL), ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (GARAGE)

prevention_tips: Verify maximum floor area for accessory buildings
Check separation distance from main building
Ensure not located in front setback
Review height limits for accessory structures

checklist_items.description: Building or structure height violations including fences and accessory buildings
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Structure exceeds maximum height for zone or type

sample_citations.description: RELAXATION: FENCE - HEIGHT
RELAXATION: FENCE - HEIGHT
RELAXATION: ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (TREEHOUSE) - LOCATED IN FLOODWAY, FINISHED FLOOR HEIGHT, BALCONY, HEIGHT ABOVE GRADE
RELAXATION: RETAINING WALL, FENCE - HEIGHT
RELAXATION: FENCE (EXISTING) - HEIGHT

prevention_tips: Confirm maximum height before design begins
Understand how height is measured (grade calculation)
Check fence height limits in front vs rear yards
Verify accessory building height restrictions

checklist_items.description: Secondary suite or accessory dwelling unit issues
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Lot size, width, or parking requirements not met

sample_citations.description: NEW: SECONDARY SUITE (BASEMENT)
NEW: SECONDARY SUITE (BASEMENT)
NEW: ROWHOUSE BUILDING (1 BUILDING), TOWNHOUSE (1 BUILDING), SECONDARY SUITE (7 SUITES), ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS (2 GARAGES)
NEW: ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (GARAGE), BACKYARD SUITE (ABOVE GARAGE)
NEW: ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (GARAGE), BACKYARD SUITE (ABOVE GARAGE)

prevention_tips: Verify lot width meets minimum requirements
Ensure parking stall requirements are met
Check for existing secondary suite restrictions
Review building code requirements separately

checklist_items.description: Insufficient parking stalls or parking stall dimensions
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Required parking stalls not provided or stall size too small

sample_citations.description: NEW: SECONDARY SUITE (BASEMENT) - PARKING STALL SIZE
NEW: SECONDARY SUITE (BASEMENT) - PARKING STALL
NEW: SECONDARY SUITE (BASEMENT) - PARKING STALL
NEW: SECONDARY SUITE (BASEMENT) - PARKING STALL DEPTH
NEW: SECONDARY SUITE (BASEMENT) - PARKING STALL

prevention_tips: Calculate parking requirements early
Verify stall dimensions (2.75m x 5.5m typical)
Consider tandem parking where permitted
Check if cash-in-lieu is available

checklist_items.description: Driveway width, length, or access point violations
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Driveway width or access location not compliant
code_references: Land Use Bylaw 1P2007 Section 54 - Driveway Requirements

sample_citations.description: RELAXATION: DRIVEWAY (ACCESS FROM BOWGLEN RD NW)
RELAXATION: DRIVEWAY - WIDTH
RELAXATION: DRIVEWAY (ACCESS FROM 8 AV SE)
RELAXATION: DRIVEWAY - WIDTH
RELAXATION: DRIVEWAY (ACCESS FROM DOVERVILLE CR)

prevention_tips: Verify maximum and minimum driveway widths
Check access restrictions on major roads
Ensure driveway length meets garage setback
Coordinate with Transportation for access approval

checklist_items.description: Parcel coverage or building coverage exceeds maximum limits
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Total building footprint exceeds percentage allowed
code_references: LUB Section 42 - Density and Building Size

sample_citations.description: RELAXATION: ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (GARAGE) - BUILDING COVERAGE
NEW: ACCESSORY RESIDENTIAL BUILDING (GARAGE) - BUILDING COVERAGE
ADDITION: SINGLE DETACHED DWELLING (REAR ATTACHED PERGOLA) - PARCEL COVERAGE
REVISION: BACKYARD SUITE (CONVERT STORAGE TO LIVING SPACE IN BASEMENT) - FLOOR AREA RELAXATION
REVISION: BACKYARD SUITE (CHANGE IN FLOOR AREA FROM DP2013-1429)

prevention_tips: Calculate parcel coverage before design
Include all structures (main building, garage, deck)
Verify coverage includes overhangs per bylaw definitions
Consider variance application if slightly over

checklist_items.description: Fence or retaining wall height or location violations
checklist_items.typical_deficiency: Fence exceeds height limits, particularly in front yard

sample_citations.description: RELAXATION: FENCE (FLOODWAY/FLOODFRINGE) - FENCE TO BE LOCATED IN FLOODWAY & FLOODFRINGE
CHANGES TO SITE PLAN: AUTOMOTIVE SERVICE (LANDSCAPING AND FENCE CHANGES)
CHANGES TO SITE PLAN: MULTI-USE COMMERCIAL (FENCE REMOVAL)
REVISION: CHANGES TO SITE PLAN (CHANGES TO LANDSCAPE FEATURES AND FENCE ON SOUTH BOUNDARY ONLY)
FENCE RELAXATION

prevention_tips: Front yard fence limit typically 1.2m
Rear/side yard fence limit typically 1.85m
Retaining walls add to fence height calculation
Corner lot visibility requirements apply
